etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in Thomas Johnson (d. 1644), apothecary and soldier. From classical Latin ferrūgineus of a dark brownish colour, (of taste) rusty (from ferrūgin-, ferrūgō iron rust + -eus: see -eous) + -ous

definitions: Resembling iron rust in colour; of a reddish brown.
Containing iron, especially in the form of hydrated oxides.
